intro: Senecio serenensis, commonly known as the Serenese groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and ragworts, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky, arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh, mountainous climates. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, helping to reduce water loss, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Senecio serenensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in its native habitat.
